title: Todd Sampson drops $43k on Qantas shares
text:
The Australian Shareholders’ Association went into Qantas’ annual general meeting in Adelaide on Friday unhappy with non-executive director Todd Sampson’s paltry shareholding in the airline after nearly five years on its board.

"Mr Sampson," wrote our colleague Patrick Durkin, "continues to be questioned by investors as an outsider to the directors club". Which is surely about the nicest thing you could say about a person.

And upon his re-election (garnering 98.85 per cent of votes cast), the ad man didn’t waste a moment righting his perceived lack of financial commitment, paying $43,750 for 7,000 shares, his first purchase in two years nearly doubling his exposure to the cyclical vagaries of our aviation market. The Toddster now owns 14,095 Qantas shares.

Given Sampson draws an annual director’s fee (and related benefits) from the Flying Kangaroo of $271,000, the company’s investors will rightly demand he keeps raising the that stake – and well before they’re asked to vote for him again in 2022.
description: The Toddster now owns 14,095 Qantas shares.
